text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A grenade blast rips off a woman's arm, fractures her legs and deforms her face at Ngando village, Nairobi on Monday.
- Member of Parliament Oki Ooko Ombaka dissociates himself from move by opposition FORD-Kenya party's Professor Anyang to take over moribund Social Democratic Party.
- Local Government Minister William ole Ntimama calls for devolution of power to local authorities to enable them to implement their own agenda.
- Police officers gun down armed suspects in a shootout at an inn in Eastleigh, Nairobi.
- Imported milk powder from Switzerland and cooking cubes from South Africa are among expired foodstuffs on sale at a Nairobi wholesaler.
- Assistant Minister for Home Affairs and National Heritage Protas Momanyi says Kenya's prisons are 30 percent overcrowded with 41,064 prisoners.
- A former permanent secretary and an ex-Nairobi provincial police officer are linked to the spate of armed robberies in Nairobi and the surrounding area in recent months.
- Kenya, in concert with other African countries, is expected to take the lead in setting a continental agenda on peace and security.
